page.title: 16ST.MARY MAGDALENE'S CHURCH
page.content: HISTORY.We looked up the Domesday Book and found that our church was built by the Saxons. You can still see a Saxon wall and doorway and sundials carved in the wall. There are medieval windows and piscina but the biggest extension was when John Bolney built the tower in 1536. It is 66ft. high, square with four small turrets, each with bands of iron to remind villagers of the wealden iron industry.It has a Tudos-style doorway and the coats of arms of John Bolnay and St. Leger. The South porch is 18th. Century and its floor is made of old gravestones. The sundial above it is dated 1850. The clock on the tower was built to celebrate Queen Victoria's Jubilee. The Victorians added the North aisle.The whole church is of local sandstone and is architecturally coherent and pleasing.
